Company Overview:

Company Overview
GEP is a diverse, creative team of 4000+ employees passionate about procurement. We invest ourselves entirely in our client’s success, creating strong collaborative relationships that deliver extraordinary value year after year. Our clients include global market leaders with international operations, Fortune 500 and Global 2000 enterprises, leading government and public institutions.
We deliver practical, effective services and software that enable procurement leaders to maximise their impact on business operations, strategy and financial performance. That’s just some of the things that we do in our quest to build a beautiful company, enjoy the journey and make a difference.
Department Overview
 As global leaders in procurement consulting, we help global organizations to rapidly achieve more efficient, more effective operations, with greater strategic reach and increased business impact. With deep expertise in procurement transformation, we guide enterprise procurement teams towards a new target operating model one where strategy, technology and operations combine to deliver game-changing business outcomes. Our comprehensive range of procurement consulting capabilities include: Procurement Transformation, Opportunity Assessment, Strategic Cost Management, M&A Services and Supply Risk Management.
What you will do:

Role Overview:
As a Senior Associate, you will be involved in every phase of a consulting engagement, from pre-proposal research through final implementation. Almost immediately, you will join a project team, working at a client location, sharing your ideas, solving problems and providing solutions in the areas of purchasing, supply chain management, business process outsourcing, and technology. Candidates will build their project management and client management skills, and further develop their communication and presentation abilities.
Location: Netherlands or Germany
Gathering and analysing data
Helping to generate proposals and lead certain client and analyst teams
Recommending actions and help clients implement them
Having opportunities to create intellectual capital and recruit new consultants
Working closely with senior management and clients to create customised purchasing proposals
Analysing client spend data and creating deliverables for the project
Introducing suppliers to the client's purchasing needs, eSourcing process, and reverse auction technology
Understanding client needs to provide flawless service
Assisting with business development activities
Working with Corporate Communications to increase awareness of our services
Working with senior management to develop selling tools for key clients
What you should bring:

Qualifications/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Accounting or related field with a GPA of 3.3 or above and at least 2-3 years prior consulting experience or industry experience
Demonstrated excellent quantitative, analytical, and communication skills
Strong academic, extracurricular, or work experience in business, Internet, or relevant industry areas is needed
Demonstrated highly motivated team player with the ability to work with minimal supervision
Proficiency in MS Office Suite: including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel (ability to create formulas and to analyse data
Fluency in at least one of the following languages: French, German, Spanish
Growth Opportunity:
Candidates will have opportunities to further develop their skills as part of their continuous professional development through various training and development techniques offered within GEP.
On-going training to enhance senior client relationship management skills
Diverse exposure to GEP’s clients in several Industry verticals – Manufacturing, LifeSciences, Automobile, CPG etc.
Lateral career progression (upon proven capabilities) to GEP’s service roles – Supply Chain, Technology and other Consulting area
Why join us?
GEP is a place where individuality is prized, and talent respected. We’re focused on what is real and effective. GEP is where good ideas and great people are recognized, results matter, ability and hard work drive achievements. We’re a learning organization, actively looking for people to help shape, grow and continually improve us.
GEP is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, national origin, religion, sex, disability status, or any other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to hiring and valuing a global diverse work team.

Job Title: Junior – Tax expert – M/F – 32-40 hours per week.
Job Description: So great that you are interested in this vacancy! We are looking for new colleagues to strengthen our team!Who are we? Looking for a challenging job in finance? Then you’re at the right place with Entrpnr!Entrpnr is the most innovative administration office in the Netherlands. From our offices in Zeewolde (Flevoland), Amsterdam and Rotterdam, we assist hundreds of SMEs nationwide (and internationally) with the processing of their financial administration.Our core business consists of the daily processing of financial administration, payroll, filing tax returns and taking care of annual work.We use the most modern software with a strong focus on automation, robotization and real-time access to figures and results.Our team currently consists of about 65 employees. Within our team we have a healthy mix of young enthusiasm, seniority and experience.One-stop-shop for entrepreneurs As an entrepreneur you can have your administration processed anywhere. At Entrpnr we therefore strongly believe in delivering added value.We do this by supporting our customers in multiple areas. It starts, of course, with the provision of tax and business advice. But we also assist our customers in obtaining financing, we support them in legal matters, with HR issues and marketing & sales.As a result, Entrpnr has become a true one-stop shop for entrepreneurs. Within the company this creates a wonderful dynamic and as a team we are continuously working to support our customers even better.Because of this, working at Entrpnr guarantees a very varied job where all employees can use their talents to the fullest for the benefit of our customers.Customer profileEntrpnr has a broad selection of customers. We work both for the small self-employed entrepreneur and for customers with multiple international branches.After a recent acquisition, we are developing ourselves strongly in the Asian market for both the home market and internationally. We have several native speakers from different cultures in our team who can support customers in their own language.We focus for a large part on customers for whom not only our services, but also the technology brings much added value. These are for example, organizations with a large numbers of commercial transactions such as successful web shops, retail and catering companies.For our team in Amsterdam we are urgently looking for:Junior – Tax expert – M/F – 32-40 hours per week. As a junior tax specialist you stand at the beginning of your career and you are looking for an ambitious company in which you can grow with the organization.You are the right-hand of the senior tax expert and you assist the other departments in supporting tax work especially within revenue tax, income tax and corporate taxes.Your work will mainly consist of processing (complex) tax declarations, identifying points for advice and improvement from these declarations, preparatory work for consultancy work and contact with the Tax Office.Who are we looking for? We would like to meet you when you:Have a relevant education at higher professional or university level or when you are already Register Tax Advisor/Consultant.You have work experience within an accounting, administration or tax consultancy firm.You're enterprising and ambitious.You like to stay up-to-date and are eager to constantly expand your own knowledge.You are available between 32 and 40 hours per week.You live within a 25km radius around our office in Rotterdam of Amsterdam.What do we offer? We offer a fun, challenging position in a dynamic and ambitious company. Of course, this function comes with a competitive salary and interesting conditions. Because of our ambition and rapid growth, there are plenty of opportunities for you to grow with us.Our Amsterdam branch is located in trendy IJburg. From our fantastic office building we look out over the marina. The mall is within walking distance as are many restaurants and bars. We offer you a beautiful, inspiring workplace with nice colleagues.The Amsterdam branch has both a strong local and international scope. As a result, we have deliberately created a multicultural team so that we can support clients from all over the world.This creates a wonderful dynamic in which we all share our knowledge and experiences. In short, a wonderful place to kickstart or restart your career!The location is perfectly accessible by car (paid parking) and via public transport. Bus and Tram stop are within walking distance.Interested? Then we would like to receive:A cover letter;Curriculum Vitae with photo;An overview of references with contact information.Job Types: New-Grad, PermanentWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Personal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Under Armour has one mission: to make you better. We have a commitment to innovation that lies at the heart of everything we do, not just for our athletes but also for our teammates. As a global organization, our teams around the world push boundaries and think beyond what is expected. Together our teammates are unified by our values and are grounded in our vision to inspire you with performance solutions you never knew you needed but can’t imagine living without.
Position Summary
Under Armour Europe B.V. (“Under Armour”) is looking for VAT Lead to oversee VAT compliance for the entire EMEA region. This position serves as a critical accounting role who will manage all aspects of VAT and will guiding Under Armour into the future while helping to manage global VAT filings, day-to-day VAT issues, driving global VAT projects and monitoring the constantly changing VAT legislation. This role will partner closely with the Global Tax team and the Controllership team, external consultants and various internal departments to build efficient processes to ensure compliance with EMEA VAT regulations.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Own all aspects of VAT compliance throughout Europe
Maintain an overview of UA VAT reporting and compliance requirements throughout Europe
Assist in the preparation and review of VAT returns (monthly, bi-monthly, quarterly) for UA EMEA entities
Assist the business in the implementation of new countries from an indirect tax perspective and with the correction of prior issues to ensure UA is recovering and reporting VAT as appropriate
Monitor VAT legislation changes, perform an impact analysis to UA and share information as appropriate throughout the organization
Liaise with other finance and business teams to increase VAT awareness and provide guidance on VAT matters
Provide practical VAT advice and VAT training to finance and business teams
Identify and communicate VAT consequences of business decisions and projects
Ensure VAT requirements are taken into consideration during implementation of
cross-functional projects, e.g. Brexit
Review legal agreements and other documentation in order to determine indirect tax consequences
Identify and implement appropriate processes and internal controls in order to minimize VAT risks
Liaise with the IT team in order to support functioning of the VAT logic within SAP and ARIBA and support the implementation of new solutions
Monitor legislation changes requiring the use of IT, e.g. ‘real-time’ reporting, e-invoicing, SAF-T, digital cash receipts
Lead the implementation of VAT-Add for SAP within EMEA including partnering with IT to ensure it is successfully implemented
Manage VAT audits and inquiries in the European countries as well as relationships with VAT and other tax authorities
Manage relationships and work pro-actively with external consultants (3rd party providers and external auditors)
Maximize automation and minimize manual workarounds in the VAT reporting process
Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)
Proven knowledge of VAT compliance in Europe while living and breathing VAT
Must be hands-on and detail oriented, while being able to see the big picture; a “thinker” and a “doer”
Experience managing VAT reporting and partnering with third party consultants
Flexible to adapt to change
Strong organizational and time management skills supported by defined processes
Strong oral and written English essential, another European language a plus
Enjoys delivering on complex work in a dynamic global operating environment
Positive attitude and dependable team player willing to “roll up their shirt sleeves” to get the work done
High level of attention to detail and ability work independently
Intellectual curiosity and strong analytical skills
Effective writing, presentation and communication skills.
Education And / Or Experience
University degree in Business Administration, Accounting Finance or a related field. Advanced degree is preferred
10+ years of relevant post-professional qualification experience with exposure to international or transactional taxes in a Big 4 public accounting firm and/or a multinational corporation
VAT compliance background including preparation of VAT compliance matters
Proven ability to successfully lead complex projects
Experience working with a tax engine; SAP accounting system experience is a plus
Digital (Ecommerce) experience is a requirement
Other Requirements
Relocation
Under Armour is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to diversity in the workplace. We encourage qualified diverse candidates to apply. Under Armour does not discriminate against any candidate on the basis of race, gender, disability, religion, national origin, age, or any other protected category.
The collection and use of personal data about applicants for employment is essential for conducting the business administration and business operation of Under Armour, Inc. (“Under Armour”) and those of its subsidiaries and affiliates. Under Armour’s overseas subsidiaries in the European Economic Area collect personal data about applicants for employment and may transfer such personal data to Under Armour in the United States in accordance with the terms of its Data Privacy Policy. Full details of Under Armour’s Data Privacy Policy are available at https://careers.underarmour.com. Under Armour has certified that it complies with the EU-US Privacy Shield Framework Principles with respect to safeguarding and transferring personal data it receives about Under Armour employees in the European Union. Further details about the Privacy Shield Framework and the list of certified companies are available at www.privacyshield.gov.

Atlassian is continuing to hire with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new and existing Atlassians will continue to work from home until it’s safe to return to our offices. When our offices re-open, we will provide the choice to work from home or return to work in an office unless a job requirement makes it necessary for a particular role to be performed at an Atlassian office.

Are you a paralegal with strong corporate skills who enjoys managing complex projects, executing quickly and with precision, working with cross-functional teams, and finding creative ways to build structure? Are you excited by a role with lots of responsibility, opportunities to wear different hats, and potential for growth and impact?

We are seeking a paralegal for our dynamic and fun-loving legal team, someone who will be a key teammate as Atlassian continues to grow and scale. As a foundational member of the legal team in Europe, you will have an exciting opportunity to grow the team, and establish the team’s presence, from the ground up!
Your Core Responsibilities Will Include
Public company matters: Work with external auditors and internal accounting team to support international audit processes.
Board and shareholder matters: Help maintain our minute books and corporate records, including for our EMEA entities. Review requests for documentation and attend to various signatures requests.
Subsidiary management: Assist on corporate compliance matters for Atlassian’s various US and international subsidiaries. Help organize subsidiary board and shareholder meetings, help to establish new entities and offices, and work extensively with tax, treasury, other departments, and outside counsel and advisors.
Transactional matters: Assist with due diligence, document preparation and execution, and closing and integration for acquisitions and other corporate transactions.
Cross-functional support/special projects: Assist with routine matters including answering various alias email boxes, managing corporate legal team files (e.g., acquisition documents, employment agreements and forms), and supporting strategic projects involving stock administration, treasury, tax, internal audit, employment/HR, and other teams.
Project management: Work with our Senior Corporate Paralegal to drive progress on corporate team and cross functional corporate projects. Look for opportunities to improve processes that will positively impact the legal team and its counterparts and help us scale. Work on other legal projects as needed, including those outside of EMEA.
On day one we will expect you to have:
2 - 4 years of relevant corporate paralegal experience in EMEA, ideally at a major law firm and/or in-house at a public company.
Ability to execute under pressure and within timelines, with tremendous organization and attention to detail and a strong sense of ownership.
Loves sizing up unstructured or ad hoc situations and working with our Senior Corporate Paralegal to create a strategy to build processes that improve accuracy or efficiency, while remaining flexible and adaptable.
Is able to be diplomatic yet effective in communicating with others and getting stuff done.
Has experience and is comfortable working alongside senior management teams, board members, and outside counsel.
Is a great teammate who is also comfortable working independently with minimal oversight on certain projects and making decisions independently.
Is familiar with Atlassian products and Docusign and/or is excited to learn more about them and put them to use.
Has a healthy sense of humor, with a how-can-I-help, get-it-done attitude.
Fluency in English (proficiency in other languages such as Dutch, German, French, or others, is a bonus).
Atlassian’s Legal Team is a valued and dynamic group. We are viewed as key partners in critical decision-making that impacts the entire company due to our practical and business-oriented advice and solutions. This small but mighty team is highly collaborative and supportive - we truly like working with each other and cheer on our teammates in all endeavors.

More about our benefits

Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more.

More about Atlassian

Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more nimble, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin, to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team.

Additional Information

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Learn more about Atlassian’s culture, interviewing flow, and hiring process by checking out our Candidate Resource Hub.

Your role:

We’re in business to save our home planet. Your role will contribute to this mission by supporting the Environmental Action Initiatives Director EMEA in the creation, management, communication (internally and externally) and successful implementation of the Company’s environmental campaigns and strategic advocacy. The ideal candidate will have a passion for action and making things happen within our environmental mission. At the same time, they need to be able to work within a business environment and with a range of very different internal and external stakeholders.

Key accountabilities:
Assist the Director in finding and shaping campaigns that align with Patagonia’s environmental mission and strategy, that deliver powerful outcomes for our planet and engage our stakeholders and customers.Develop messaging and multi-channel strategies to communicate with and activate our stakeholders and customersProject manage the development and execution of those strategies across channels and across Europe.Play a key role in the launch and ongoing activation of the environmental campaigns. This may include representing the Company at launch events/ activities, communicating launch messaging to key partner groups and maintaining partnership/ collaborative relationships throughout the campaign.Work with the Environmental Action Initiatives Director to develop a content strategy and appropriate content for Patagonia’s marketing teams to educate and engage customers on key environmental issues and to take action in their lives as well as to deepen customers’ understanding of Patagonia’s approach and values.In conjunction with the Sports Marketing Coordinator, develop partnerships with athletes and other content providers who can amplify the environmental messages.Lead employee education and activation for all campaigns and advocacy issues. Develop educational programs and presentations to deliver news and information about our campaigns and ensure employee engagement.In partnership with HR EMEA leader and team, lead initiatives to foster employees’ journey to become agents of change, increasing their personal involvement with our mission statement.Along with the Director, be ready to advocate and represent Patagonia’s position externally to key stakeholders, at stakeholder events as neededPerform research for the Company’s external environmental efforts and ensure that such initiatives are delivering against their objectives.Respond to day-to-day requests, opportunities and urgent needs for political engagement in the environmental sectorRepresent Patagonia as needed with educational institutions.Lead, develop and manage one direct report.

Administrative Responsibilities
Responsible for the project planning and day-to-day administration of the Company’s campaigns and advocacy activities.Ensure that the Company’s campaigns and advocacy activities provide good customer service to non-profit organizations, employees, customers, outdoor industry and the general public.

Inter-Company Responsibilities
Ensure that all campaigns and advocacy activities reflect the philosophy of the Company.Support other departments in the Company in their aims and encourage them to help deliver Patagonia’s environmental aims.

Pre-requisites:

In order to succeed in this role, it is expected that you will be/have:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Environmental Studies, Science, Policy or substantial experience working in the environmental movementExperience of developing and delivering successful multi-channel and multinational environmental campaigns
Ability to activate audiences that have different levels of environmental knowledge/engagement.Good influencing and communications skills, able to motivate and manage diverse stakeholders.Excellent project management skills with a good attention to detailIn-depth knowledge about environmental activism in the European context.Effective and inspiring ambassador of the brand, representing the company in external and internal events.Work experience in both businesses and non-profit organizations is a plus.Understanding of political process and experience in shaping public policy is a plus.Experience of employee engagement is a plus.Demonstrated ability to handle controversial issues professionally.Language skills: fluent in English, other languages are a plus.Comfortable with team-based work structure. Hands-on, proactive and flexible attitude.Strong buy-in to the Patagonia business and mission statement.

Patagonia is committed to equal employment opportunities and diversity.

Employee Conduct:

It is the responsibility of every employee to contribute to a positive work environment through cooperative and professional interactions with co-workers, customers and vendors.

Please make sure that your CV and cover letter are in English.

The Opportunity:
We’re looking for a Senior Educational Consultant to help us push the boundaries of what education can offer through the power of technology. Education is our passion, and our team members bring that to work each day as they aim to advance learning in every region of the world. Blackboard is the world's leading education technology company, providing dynamic products and services to the global education community. We’re focused on driving innovation in EdTech and working with our clients to create a smarter learning environment.
For more information about Blackboard Inc. and our career opportunities, please visit www.blackboard.com.
Blackboard’s Educational Consulting & Training team supports clients in the effective implementation of Blackboard products to support online teaching and learning, ensure successful adoption of our products, and maximize the educational returns on the client's investment. We provide clients with strategic consulting services which include defining requirements and business rules, facilitating application strategy sessions, drafting specifications, identifying implementation strategies and product use cases, providing product training, providing instructional design and course design services, and leading the process that delivers our client systems to the production state. As Senior Educational Consultant, you will play an integral role in the success of the group.
Primary responsibilities will include:
Analyzing client needs and identifying Blackboard products and services that aligns to these needs
Identifying gaps in client skills, processes, or infrastructure
Developing client-specific implementation project plans and timelines
Developing and presenting at meetings with prospects, which will include executive level customer sponsors and Blackboard Collaborate senior leadership
Identifying customer risks, implementing risk mitigation plans, and communicating to senior leadership
Partnering with Sales, Marketing and Product Development to create comprehensive customer solutions
Identifying unique requirements for large and strategic accounts and coordinate with other Blackboard departments to ensure successful delivery
Monitoring, tracking and reporting project status and performance
Conducting meetings with client sponsors and stakeholders
Creating and delivering implementation reports

 What you’ll do:

Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s HRIS and talent management systems.
Comfortable with public speaking and running training programs.

5-7 years of human resource management experience.
Experience with international expansion (has seen massive scale and change management a plus).

Equity in a fast growing company.

Since 2018, Synthesis has been offering legal, medically supervised and science-based psychedelic retreats in Amsterdam for open-minded seekers who want to utilize moderate-to-high doses of psilocybin truffles to catalyze creative breakthroughs, explore consciousness, find meaning, improve confidence, and open up to a mystical experience.

With the FDA designating psilocybin therapy a “breakthrough therapy,” and thereby helping to speed up the process of researching and approving it to treat major depressive disorder (MDD), now a new era is upon us—one in which psychiatrists will be able to legally prescribe psychedelics in the United States.

Deeply rooted in its vision that everyone has access to mental health and wellbeing, Synthesis is uniquely poised to usher in this new era, pioneering as a global leader in advancing research, convening community, educating the public and engaging in activism to promote safe, legal, widespread access to psychedelics.

Standing on its years of experience and reputation for offering world-class psilocybin experiences,

Synthesis is also uniquely qualified to set the standard for practitioners to safely, ethically and effectively support people on a journey for healing using psilocybin.

The Synthesis Institute is an Amsterdam based company. We are accepting candidates globally and will consider candidates willing and able to telecommute.


Position Overview:

We seek a full-time Chief Operating Officer to support and lead the organization's operations and procedures with their multinational enterprise experience. This candidate will align their work with Synthesis’ mission and vision . This candidate will be a key member of the senior management team, reporting to the CEO. The ideal candidate will maintain control of diverse business operations, and is expected to be an experienced and efficient leader. This person must have excellent people skills, business insights, financial understanding, and exemplary work ethics. Candidate will work closely with the leads of all divisions of the organization in order to help streamline communications and make sure teams are working as efficiently as possible with one another. In addition, this candidate must have expert level understanding of how to assist in creating a culture that thrives in an open, honest, and transparent work environment, helping to inspire the team as a whole.

Core Objectives:

Secure the functionality of internal operations to drive extensive and sustainable growth. Have sound knowledge of business strategies, culture, finances, and project management across. Support a team that handles day-to-day administration and operations of business. Provide leadership, management, and vision to ensure that Synthesis has an effective team, operational controls, and administrative and reporting procedures in place. This candidate will help scale transformational psychedelic experiences worldwide and ensure its financial strength and operating efficiency.

Responsibilities:
Help lead Organization’s daily operations
Team up with management to build visionary business strategies
Help spearhead strategies to steer company’s growth in a positive direction
Lead the company’s international operating capabilities
Help implement innovative and best business practices
Delegate responsibilities to ensure growth of organization and projects
Assist in coaching employees to optimize their capabilities
Assess and implement improved processes across the organization’s management team.
Lead employees to encourage maximum performance,dedication, and innovation.
Participate in expansion activities (investments, acquisitions, corporate alliances etc.)

Required Experience:
5+ years of experience in a multinational environment
Proven track record of excellent performance in a team of 50+

Detailed oriented and organized, creating structure and streamlining processes for maximum effectiveness

Have self-care and inter-personal integrity as a top priority in your personal life

Amsterdam, Netherlands
Legal and Public Policy
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service. With 195 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages, it’s an exciting time to work at Netflix. The Public Policy team at Netflix is based around the globe and proactively manages the company's relationship with government officials and advises the company on regulatory matters. Additionally, the team engages with governments on a variety of issues and initiatives that materially impact our business or our members in hopes of setting Netflix up for success and growth around the world. The EU's Audiovisual Media Services Directive (AVMSD) sets out EU legislation implemented in all EU member states on all audiovisual media where Public policy is engaging with local stakeholders to ensure fair and equitable rules and their application. We are seeking an experienced Coordinator who will be responsible for supporting Public Policy (reporting to EU Media and AVMS Policy position), in the compliance with these rules once put in place whilst also being a key point of support for teams (e.g. legal, content & finance) around the organization.

The successful candidate will have broad responsibility for tracking and coordinating the tactical details of the company’s AVMSD compliance strategy, and will be self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail. This is a demanding and fast-paced role that requires curiosity and significant initiative.
The Role:
External routine communication with regulators to ensure timely compliance once the rules and their application are in place.
Overseeing the calendar of all the compliance deadlines and tasks to make sure all the involved teams stay on track for compliance.
Overseeing and preparing individual compliance submissions by sourcing input from all the relevant teams.
Effective understanding of legal documents and the European audiovisual production ecosystem to source, update and coordinate internal teams involved in compliance.
Liaising with all cross-functional teams in legal, content & finance and serving as the go-to point of contact for AVMSD compliance.
Proactively bringing up issues impacting compliance with existing obligations to the relevant teams.
Proactively engage with business content teams to assist decision-making on investments based on existing obligations and financial forecasts
Maintaining flexibility and openness to take on additional projects as necessary.
Organize, log, and maintain accurate data regarding the compliance submissions.
Work closely with engineering teams across the company to help build and test relevant compliance related tools (as needed).
Maintain internal AVMSD documents and prepare summaries of legal research.
Proactively learning about the company’s innovation efforts for AVMSD compliance and updating cross-functional partners.
Qualifications:
Prior experience (5+ years) with regulatory compliance and administration (ideally in the space of media & entertainment regulation on EU or individual country specific level)
Content-related work experience in media and research and data analytic experience positively valued.
Professional written and verbal communication skills in English and one more language (ideally Dutch or French).
Paralegal or similar Academic degree in an area related to the position (e.g. legal, administration, media) positively valued.
High level of organization, detail orientation, ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines and a mindset that processes can always be improved; strong critical thinking and operational skills
Team-player who thrives in a fast paced, team-oriented setting
Flexibility and willingness to provide administrative support on a broad range of regulatory matters (including preparing summaries of legal research).
Tech-savvy individual, quick to adapt to new or changing systems, with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Google Suite.
Ability to be discrete and maintain confidential information.
Willingness to tackle matters outside area of expertise.
Understand, advocate, and embody the Netflix culture and team goals.

Job description

G-Star strives to be the most hardcore denim brand in the world. To achieve this, we are looking for hardcore thinkers and do-ers, who dare to create the future of premium and purposeful denim with us.

We are looking for people with big dreams, while keeping their feet on the ground. Those who are not afraid to push the limits, because we believe there are no limits in what denim can do.

Are you up for the challenge? Are you the perfect fit for our team? Are you a bit of a rebellious spirit?
Then we would love to hear from you!

Here’s what we’ll do together:

New technologies are continuously suppressing each other faster and faster. The amount of data is increasing, applications are getting smarter and computers are getting faster. The interaction with customers is changing and so are the demands customers place on business processes. To you as an intern, that sounds like the start of something beautiful because with data, among other things, you lay the foundation for better business processes. During the internship, you will be prepared as a process consultant to work with colleagues to look for possibilities to increase process efficiency, reduce costs and shorten lead times. In other words, you ensure a qualitatively strong and thorough process.

Profile

What you bring to the table:

You are analytically strong, can assess a situation quickly and show initiative and perseverance. You are enrolled at a technical or numerical academic study (think of Mathematics or Physics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics or Public Administration). You have the ambition to work in the field of Customer Excellence, Business Process Management, Digital Process Transformation, translating operational data into processes, and Continuous Improvement. You would like to discover where your talents lie and give a quick start to your career. You also bring personality: you can find yourself in our core values.

What we bring to the table:

A successful start to your career! During this internship, we give you a solid foundation in the field of functional knowledge within the fashion industry, BPM, Business Process Improvement and of course also a great experience by working for an iconic denim brand. During 5-6 months, you will work intensively on your personal and professional development by means of training and knowledge sessions. For example, you follow training courses aimed at business process improvement that give you the knowledge to support various teams within G-star in providing insight into the business processes and to discuss improvements together. We share knowledge and also regularly plan social activities. We work hard, but fun is just as important.

Beyond a competitive compensation for your internship, working at G-Star brings a lot of perks and exciting opportunities… how about an awesome and diverse team that collaborates to inspire; a work environment that offers room for fun, inspiration and innovation … and a healthy, fresh and delicious lunch so you can keep up the greatness!

Found your dream internship?
We will thoroughly review your application.We have an international community at G-Star, so please apply in English.When we hopefully find what we are looking for, we will call you for a chat and if it’s a good fit, we’ll plan our first interview. Because we’re very curious how you’d survive a mission impossible, we ask you to prepare a real-life business case.When we’re ready to commit to each other, we will congratulate you on your brand new internship and discuss the next steps. We look forward to see you on the onboarding day!

RITTERWALD is growing its consultancy services in The Netherlands and United Kingdom and we are looking for an ambitious Junior Consultant to support our business outside Germany.

RITTERWALD is a pan-European strategy consultancy in the real-estate industry with offices in Berlin, Frankfurt, Amsterdam and London (2021). Over the last 10 years, we have developed strong client relationships in the public and private sector in the field of sustainability, social and affordable housing and urban development.
We would like to get in touch with a talented Junior Consultant who can support our senior management in Amsterdam and – prior to opening of our London office – our Director UK. The position is based in The Netherlands at our Amsterdam office near RAI convention centre and across Beatrix Park, however some home working is possible.

You offer
a successfully completed degree in business administration or real estate management (Bachelor, Master)

potentially first experience in a professional environment (private or public sector, consulting, auditing, etc.)

a strong understanding of business topics in its societal context
a quick grasp and distinctive problem-solving competence
an authentic, independent and motivated personality
flexibility, mobility and commitment
ability to work in a team
fluent language skills in Dutch and English and preferably some (basic) German
You will
further develop the market presence of RITTERWALD by supporting acquisitions, writing articles and participating in external conferences and seminars
support us with market and trend analyses, company profiles for our business development and marketing and participating in teams with your colleagues to support client projects
work in customer projects by focussing on consulting topics such as business planning, cost, sales and process analyses as well as benchmarking and digitisation topics
provide office related support to our Business Development Director (based in Amsterdam) and our Director UK (based in London): scheduling but more importantly preparing meetings
We offer
from the 1st working day deployment on strategic customer projects in international markets
a high learning curve and an optimal environment for personal development
an experienced colleague as a mentor, who will assist you with advice and action
a wide range of training and continuing education opportunities
opportunity to grow with RITTERWALD
a pleasant working atmosphere, true team spirit, company events (with involvement of partners & children)
negotiable salary

As a Consultant at Zanders, you can expect to work on live projects almost immediately. You will receive training and support from your senior colleagues as well as the opportunity to study for the CFA exams. There willbe plenty of scope to work with multinational corporations, both locally and internationally, guiding and implementing treasury solutions. We are searching for talented, technical graduates who have a passion for technology transformations and an interest in the intersection of technology and finance.

Your role

You will be a part of our Corporates consulting team based in the Netherlands. We are looking for a graduate that wants to be at the forefront of using, and advancing, technology within corporate finance and treasury departments.

The range of responsibilities for this role includes:

Work alongside clients to identify how technology fits into their strategic roadmap
Review how clients currently use financial technology, identify best practice improvements, and implement those changes
Work alongside senior level colleagues to help manage the project success and align with client expectations
Advance the project work by completing assigned tasks or providing client support
Decide which market trends and legislation to research so that you can develop your own expertise within Zanders
Skills to be successful
Interested in a career in finance and technology, with a specialzed focus in treasury and risk management solutions
Motivated to work on projects with competing deadlines, change management and a systems/process focus
Ability to inspire and open up dialogue with colleagues and clients
Ambition to further your education, such as CFA or financial systems training
Drawn to a career in consulting that involves specialization, emotional intelligence and strong relationship management
Completed Master’s in a relevant study: Finance, Business Administration, Information Systems
What we offer you

We offer an ambitious, international and fun working environment. We find a healthy work-life balance very important and offer the flexibility needed to combine a career as a consultant with a busy personal life. We have ambitious growth targets for the coming years and are looking for people that want to help us achieve these goals. Whether you want to develop new products, clients or expertise areas, there is ample room for your initiatives and ambitions. In addition we offer the following:

A spot in the Zanders Talent Program (ZTP) to hone your soft skills and content knowledge with your class of new colleagues
The opportunity to establish yourself as a subject matter expert in your chosen field
The chance to work alongside a variety of clients and consultants to build new skills quickly
A fun and enterprising organization that encourages, motivates and focuses on its people
Who we are

We are a leading international consultancy firm focused on Treasury Management, Risk Management and Corporate Finance. From our offices in the Netherlands, Belgium, United Kingdom, Switzerland, Nordics, United States and Japan our 190 consultants service corporates, financial institutions, public sector entities and NGO’s.

We believe that developing our people by investing in them and by sharing knowledge and experiences is our differentiator and key to success. That is why we create an inspiring work environment and foster our open, family atmosphere in which freedom, fun and flexibility play an important role. It is also why we aim to make our next project even more exciting and challenging.

By applying for a role at Zanders, you give us approval to use and retain your personal details. Taking into account Zanders’ nature of enterprise, you are expected to behave to a high moral standard. A Pre-Employment Screening (PES) by a third party is part of the application process.

TPV Technology is an internationally-renowned PC monitor, TV and Digital Signage Displays manufacturer. TPV serves as an original design manufacturer for some of the best-known TV , PC and Digital Signage Displays brands in the industry and distributes its products worldwide under its own brands AOC and Envision. In addition, the company designs, produces and sells Philips-branded monitors, TV's and AVA products, Digital Signage Displays and mobile phones through a license agreement with Philips via its subsidiaries TP Vision and MMD. As an example, the company brings high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. TPV believes in creating products that touch the human senses and are within reach of all consumers in the markets they operate in. As a leader in the hotel industry, their hospitality TV division serves most the world's major international and national hotel groups, as well as individual hotels, hospitals, cruises and other professional facilities.


About AOC
Headquartered in Amsterdam, AOC International (Europe) B.V. is one of Europe’s leading suppliers of computer displays and IT accessories, and number one gaming monitor brand in the world. The AOC brand was founded in Taiwan in 1967 as the Admiral Overseas Corporation. It is now part of TPV Technology Limited – the world’s largest PC monitor manufacturer.
Scope
Amsterdam ( The Netherlands) – The Product Manager is responsible for leading business management activities within Europe for accessories. The Product manager will manage the price realization, volumes and margin and is involved directly on P&L discussions.
Responsibilities
Business activities include product range build up and logic from commercial point of view, product lifecycle management, pricing and margin management within Europe and recommendation on channel management strategy. Ownership and accountability differ and it is dependent on seniority.
Identify additional opportunities within the current branded portfolio.
Benchmarking competitor product range and pricing
Project management with Asian HQ Global Product Management
Support regional sales for public or corporate tenders
Defining product positioning and pricing in corporation with Product Managers of other brands being covered by the organisation
Preparing and executing sales trainings
Preparing and executing PR Agency briefings and trainings
Defining and briefing Marcom for all hero and focus products launch campaigns
Business Management analysis and strategy setting for all countries
Close corporation with supply chain to manage stock level and availabilities
Certification management and full control of internal and external operational processes related to business unit.
Sample management (monitors/displays) press reviews in corporation with Marcom
Work with sales teams to identify growth opportunities to increase market share, sales and margin
Build & coordinate with assigned market(s) the best product range and line up logic to optimize financial results
Manage price realization & optimize operational margin for assigned markets to reach and exceed targets
Drive product mix improvement
Drive & support implementation of regional strategy to assigned markets
Support for allocation prioritization (to benefit EU region)
Analyse markets and become business expert and support regional leadership to understand challenges and opportunities for assigned markets
Certification management and full control of internal and external operational processes related to business unit
What are we offering?
Fulltime position and competitive rewards , based in Amsterdam
An interesting, dynamic, challenging, and fast-moving international working environment
Opportunity to grow true business sense
Requirements
Bachelor education in Business Administration / Marketing
Experience and track record in product management (strong preference for experience with Consumer Electronics/display products)
In-depth knowledge of markets, pricing, margin management, P&L and strategy
Ability to coordinate business on regional level and at country (senior) level
Experience in product market introductions
Strong verbal and written communication in English (and preferably Dutch and another language)
If you enjoy working with knowledgeable, success oriented people, for a company that both challenges and respects its professionals, and you've got what it takes to be a great Product Manager, then apply today.

Deal breakers, value drivers, cash flows, data analytics, working capital and upside potential, are all keywords used within mergers, acquisitions, IPOs and (re) financing processes that you work on as a Financial Due Diligence manager at PwC.
Our Deals business is an exciting and an ever-growing business that focuses on deals and crisis situations for our clients. Collectively, we deal with the types of situations you hear about regularly in the news and we provide support, insight and analysis to the management, shareholders and financiers of business.
What does the job involve?
You help clients looking to buy a business, sell all or part of their business, refinance or list on stock exchanges through Initial Public Offerings (IPOs). Your work helps buyers understand what makes a transaction successful. You thoroughly assess a target company’s finances, consider the opportunities and risks, and identify potential deal issues. You also work with vendors; independently assessing businesses so that potential buyers can make informed decisions.
What exactly a financial due diligence process looks like depends entirely on the project. You will solve each problem with a tailor-made approach. Sometimes, a financial 'snapshot' of the company suffices, whereas at another time, the deal issue will only be visible on a very detailed X-ray. Depending on the client’s request, you look at the history or the projections of an organization. Each assignment will be completely different in terms of both content and process.
You will have the opportunity to work on both strategic and private equity transactions that will be varied and challenging. Advising throughout the deal cycle, you’ll see both the buy and sell side of the work, develop specialist sector understanding and enhance key skills in financial due diligence.You are part of a leading (inter) national Deals practice where innovation is central;
You work in project teams with specialists, often supplemented with tax specialists and strategy, carve-out, synergy or IT experts. Your common goal is to get the most out of the deal for the client;
You support private equity parties and corporates in the purchase and sale of companies or business units. In addition to involvement in the transaction itself, you will also be involved before and after the transaction discussing strategic matters with the client;
You also coach and help your team members in their development and you are the person they can turn to for discussing their activities, ideas or proposals.
Who are you?
You have experience in financial due diligence within an advisory practice or experience that is complementary to doing financial due diligence: i.e. experience of analysing financial information to identify key commercial drivers, risks and opportunities and reviewing financial projections. You have an ability to identify key issues and to deliver on time. You have great interpersonal skills and are able to quickly build collaborative relationships with a wide range of stakeholders internally as well as externally. Finally, you enjoy bringing the best out of your team and using your practical and creative skills to analyse and solve new issues.
In addition:
You have studied Business Administration or (Business) Economics at a university, supplemented by a completed RA, RC or CFA (level 3) program.
You like to work in an (international) team and have good project management skills.
You have excellent analytical, excel and reporting skills in both Dutch and English.
You can empathize with your colleagues and stakeholders and you have an eye for the added value of everyone.
You are passionate about client service and have commercial awareness
You are curious about the developments in your field and are driven to make a difference with your team.
What do we offer?
A job with PwC means working with a wide variety of clients and inspiring colleagues. It also comes with a competitive employee benefits package that gives you ample room to grow and work and live flexibly.
You will have access to many different training courses and programmes.
You will be part of an international advisory organisation.
You will play an important role in prestigious transformation projects.
You will have an outstanding package of employee and fringe benefits, including company car, lease bike option, laptop, iPhone, 32 vacation days, and a personal wellbeing budget.
Informal (online) get together activities like drinks, Christmas party, sportive events and more!

It’s an exciting time to join Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment globally. Our international efforts have brought Netflix to virtually all countries around the globe and we are excited to bring even more content to our viewers everywhere.

The Rights Management team is looking for a Rights Analyst to join its expanding team in EMEA where they’ll be based at Netflix’s Amsterdam office. They will be responsible for analyzing contracts for owned and licensed content for Europe, Middle East & Africa and creating the distribution windows and rights information in Netflix’s proprietary rights management system for titles launching on the Netflix service.

The successful candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, flexible, quick-thinking and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze and interpret agreements for owned and licensed content and accurately set up distribution windows and other rights attributes in our rights management system.
Maintain high alignment with various cross-functional partners (Acquisitions, Legal, Title Operations, Marketing, Content Accounting, etc.) to manage all aspects of window set-up for the successful launch of titles on the Netflix Service.
Strive for tool and process improvements and work towards implementing solutions.
Maintain high alignment with the Rights Management team in Los Angeles and other regional offices.
ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
Cross-Functional Partners: you must have the ability to establish highly effective relationships with your business partners.
Judgment: you must be able to think strategically, assess risk and make wise decisions.
Prioritization and organization: you must be able to juggle time-sensitive requests from multiple business partners.
Attention to detail: you must be able to manage a high volume of information with great accuracy.
Strong analytical skills: you must be comfortable reading complex contracts for owned and licensed content and accurately extracting rights metadata.
Strong problem-solving skills: you must be resourceful and collaborative in managing challenging tasks.
Technology Savvy: you must be comfortable learning new tools quickly. Strong knowledge in Excel is preferred.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills: you must be able to distill information accurately and convey it to your business partners.
Feedback: you must be able to provide to and receive from your colleagues real-time, direct feedback.
QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of experience in Sales, Sales Administration, and/or content rights management required
Prior experience within a studio, streaming service, or TV/Film distributor highly preferred
Fluency in English required
Minimal travel required

Since 2018, Synthesis has been offering legal, medically supervised and science-based psychedelic retreats in Amsterdam for open-minded seekers who want to utilize moderate-to-high doses of psilocybin truffles to catalyze creative breakthroughs, explore consciousness, find meaning, improve confidence, and open up to a mystical experience.

With the FDA designating psilocybin therapy a “breakthrough therapy,” and thereby helping to speed up the process of researching and approving it to treat major depressive disorder (MDD), now a new era is upon us—one in which psychiatrists will be able to legally prescribe psychedelics in the United States.

Deeply rooted in its vision that everyone has access to mental health and wellbeing, Synthesis is uniquely poised to usher in this new era, pioneering as a global leader in advancing research, convening community, educating the public and engaging in activism to promote safe, legal, widespread access to psychedelics.

Standing on its years of experience and reputation for offering world-class psilocybin experiences,

Synthesis is also uniquely qualified to set the standard for practitioners to safely, ethically and effectively support people on a journey for healing using psilocybin.

The Synthesis Institute is an Amsterdam based company. We are accepting candidates globally and will consider candidates willing and able to telecommute.


Position Overview:

We seek a full-time Clinical Operations Director to support and lead the clinical team’s operations and administrative work. This candidate will align their work with Synthesis’ mission and vision . This candidate will be a key member of the senior management team and will work closely with the Clinical Director and screening team. The ideal candidate will maintain tight organization of this team's daily operations, manage cross departmental communications, and is expected to be an experienced and efficient leader. In addition, this candidate must have an advanced understanding of psychedelic therapy, and experience in planning events as the Clinical Operations Director will be responsible for the operations of psilocybin retreats for the clinical program.


Core Objectives:

Lead and grow Synthesis internal clinical operations and programming. This person must have sound knowledge of medical and clinical regulations as well as an expert level understanding of project management. Lead a team that handles day-to-day administration and operations, provide leadership, management, and vision to ensure that Synthesis has an effective team, operational controls, and administrative procedures in place. This candidate will help effectively grow the clinical team and ensure it is operating efficiently.


Responsibilities:
Assist Clinical Director
Lead and coordinate operational and administrative duties for the clinical team and department
Lead cross departmental communications
Manage Health Screening process
 Lead Clinical Governance for the clinical team: annual audits of processes, writing audit reports suggesting operational improvements, and overseeing the transition to new improved processes
Train and grow clinical teams
Managing day-to-day operations, budgeting, financial management, and human resource management
Planning and coordinating psilocybin retreats serving large groups of therapy clients


Required Experience:
5+ years of experience leading and growing clinical operations
5+ years of experience in client/patient intake and health screening processes
Understand the deep responsibility to deliver ethical psychedelic care
Masters degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, Nursing or related field preferred
Proven track record of excellent performance in a clinical setting
Broad knowledge of modern health care administration practices and principles within a managed care environment and/or an academic medical center
Deep personal experience with altered states
Feels personally inspired by the tremendous potential of psychedelics to positively change our collective healthcare and wellbeing landscape

Product Manager Accessories EU
TPV Technology is an internationally-renowned PC monitor, TV and Digital Signage Displays manufacturer. TPV serves as an original design manufacturer for some of the best-known TV , PC and Digital Signage Displays brands in the industry and distributes its products worldwide under its own brands AOC and Envision. In addition, the company designs, produces and sells Philips-branded monitors, TV’s and AVA products, Digital Signage Displays and mobile phones through a license agreement with Philips via its subsidiaries TP Vision and MMD. As an example, the company brings high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. TPV believes in creating products that touch the human senses and are within reach of all consumers in the markets they operate in. As a leader in the hotel industry, their hospitality TV division serves most the world’s major international and national hotel groups, as well as individual hotels, hospitals, cruises and other professional facilities.
About the company
MMD is a wholly-owned company by TPV, established in 2009 through a brand license agreement with Philips. MMD exclusively markets and sells Philips-branded LCD displays worldwide. Taking advantage of Philips brand image and TPV’s manufacturing expertise, MMD uses a fast and focused approach to bring innovative products to consumers. MMD serves worldwide markets from major regional offices including Amsterdam, Shanghai, Singapore, São Paulo and Fremont (EPI). Through its network of local sales teams MMD works with all major IT distributors and resellers.
Scope
Amsterdam ( The Netherlands) – The Product Manager is responsible for leading business management activities within Europe for accessories. The Product manager will manage the price realization, volumes and margin and is involved directly on P&L discussions.
Responsibilities
Business activities include product range build up and logic from commercial point of view, product lifecycle management, pricing and margin management within Europe and recommendation on channel management strategy. Ownership and accountability differ and it is dependent on seniority.
Identify additional opportunities within the current branded portfolio.
Benchmarking competitor product range and pricing
Project management with Asian HQ Global Product Management
Support regional sales for public or corporate tenders
Defining product positioning and pricing in corporation with Product Managers of other brands being covered by the organisation
Preparing and executing sales trainings
Preparing and executing PR Agency briefings and trainings
Defining and briefing Marcom for all hero and focus products launch campaigns
Business Management analysis and strategy setting for all countries
Close corporation with supply chain to manage stock level and availabilities
Certification management and full control of internal and external operational processes related to business unit.
Sample management (monitors/displays) press reviews in corporation with Marcom
Work with sales teams to identify growth opportunities to increase market share, sales and margin
Build & coordinate with assigned market(s) the best product range and line up logic to optimize financial results
Manage price realization & optimize operational margin for assigned markets to reach and exceed targets
Drive product mix improvement
Drive & support implementation of regional strategy to assigned markets
Support for allocation prioritization (to benefit EU region)
Analyse markets and become business expert and support regional leadership to understand challenges and opportunities for assigned markets
Certification management and full control of internal and external operational processes related to business unit
What are we offering?
Fulltime position and competitive rewards , based in Amsterdam
An interesting, dynamic, challenging, and fast-moving international working environment
Opportunity to grow true business sense
Requirements
Bachelor education in Business Administration / Marketing
Experience and track record in product management (strong preference for experience with Consumer Electronics/display products)
In-depth knowledge of markets, pricing, margin management, P&L and strategy
Ability to coordinate business on regional level and at country (senior) level
Experience in product market introductions

Profile
Taxture (www.Taxture.com) is intending to recruit an experienced Back Office professional.

interesting job opportunity. Someone who is eager to help our organization to become even

aware that within Taxture our definition of Back Office operations does include occasional

contact with the customer. We are a strong service minded company. In this role you will be

responsible for further developing and assisting the finance back-office functions in the likes of

CRM, Client acceptance portfolio (CDD), Order2Cash and Procurement. Strong affinity with

manage all processes required by our customers to ensure our invoices are accepted and paid.

In addition, you will be able to enforce credit control and handle disputes. You will report to and

assist the Finance & Compliance Director. This implies that you understand the concepts of a

professional service firm, whereby the partners and director expect you to be a sparring partner

as well as a driver to make certain that finance and back office operations work as accurate as a

Swiss watch.

Taxture is a fast growing multidisciplinary service firm that as of its start in 2009 has been

involved in advising its clients on complex international tax matters. After its start gradually the

services offerings have been extended, adding tax compliance and audit services. As per 2017

also legal services were added and public notaries have complemented the service practice.

The clients of Taxture consist of multinational organizations as well as large family owned

companies. The practice has an international character. Although the work climate is informal,

advisor teams continuously provide advisory services at the highest levels in order to retain

customer satisfaction.

You have at least 5 years’ experience in finance- and back office operations

economic manner

cash conversion cycle should be as short as possible
You are representative and capable, verbally and in writing with clients and other departments
in a professional manner

You are able to self-start and bring tasks to a successful end
You see it as your personal mission to promptly resolve, or ensure that others resolve, all
situations that if left unattended can eventually lead to loss of revenue

You are able to settle and clear items with a service minded and administrative approach

A completed education in finance / business administration at HBO level
At least 5 years relevant experience in financial operations and back office related activities

Knowledge of Order2Cash and Procurement set-up. Preferable in an AFAS/Profit ERP
environment

Working as a SOX Manager you are expected to autonomously manage SOX program activities related to business process controls documentation and testing. Also, actively look for areas of improvements in the SOX program and function, mitigate risks within the scope of the approved program, as well as maintain and strengthen the role of the department as a valued business partner.

The SOX Manager will be responsible for developing the global SOX compliance strategy, program roadmap and plan, and executing on the plan to implement the SOX compliance program. This role will also provide oversight to audit activities as it relates to SOX or otherwise as needed. In this position you will be reporting to the Head of Internal Audit, Risk & Control.

Your responsibilities will be the following:

Maintain strong working relationships and remain engaged with business finance and functional leaders to stay up-to-date on business operations and emerging risks to provide input to internal audit and SOX risk assessment and planning activities.
Oversee and manage SOX program activities and the SOX business process controls team to complete the annual SOX plan as scheduled within the allotted time frame and budget.
Provide timely, clear, relevant and actionable feedback, tailored to the specific business environment, regarding SOX findings/deficiencies or opportunities for improvement.
Draft SOX audit reports or other deliverables in a timely manner with minimal revisions required.
Manage the process for follow-up on outstanding audit findings and SOX deficiencies.
Lead internal audit and external, co-sourced resources to ensure work is completed timely, accurately and adheres to department policies and procedures.
Maintain and continuously improve the SOX program methodology, processes and department policies and procedures.
Serve as a key liaison with the external auditors to plan and coordinate quarterly and annual SOX audit activities.
Communicate expectations and provide training or other guidance to business process owners and control owners regarding SOX compliance requirements.
Functie-eisen
To successfully execute this role, the following skills are required:
University degree preferably in economics, finance, accounting & audit and/or business administration
Professional certification such as CPA, CIA, ACCA, CIMA, CISA or similar
Thorough knowledge of, experience in working with, accounting theory, internal control and auditing standards, particularly exceptional knowledge of the US Sarbanes-Oxley Act and its implementation in a US publicly traded company
Minimum of 6+ years audit, SOX and/or internal controls experience in public accounting and/or internal audit function in a large international company, including prior experience managing within a SOX program or audit department for a US publicly traded company
Knowledge and experience with IT systems, particularly SAP and SAP GRC, and IT SOX controls is a plus.
Strong project management skills and ability to effectively manage external resources and indirect reports
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with people at all levels and across the company
Fluent business English is required. Knowledge of other languages is a strong advantage
Beside those skills, we are also looking for someone who has excellent communication and presentation skills combined with being a strong teamplayer. You have to have the ability to process and analyze information and develop related action plans.
Over het bedrijf
The company is the world's biggest international provider of essential chemistry.

The SOX program is part of the Internal Audit, Risk Management and Internal Control function that employs about 20 FTEs in several locations across the globe (Europe, USA, China). This position shall be located at the US Corporate HQ in Radnor, PA and in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. You will be required to travel 50% of the time.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Salary €7.000 - €8.000 gross per month
Travel allowance: €0.19 cent per km
40 hours workweek
Willingness to travel 50% or more of the time
